answers.answer: Hi,The normal range for adults is as follows:Fasting(atleast 8 hours): less than 100mg/dLAfter eating: less than 140 mg/dLThe American Diabetes  Association also has some good information on their site www.diabetes.org.Take care.

Hi Gerry46In South Africa it ranges between around 5 and 7, I know it's measured differently in America and I think there it's between 70 - 120, according to this website anyway: http://mybloodsugar.net/sugar_levels.htmI'm not a doctor, just a patient but I hope this helps.

question: What is the normal blood sugar level for non-diabetics?
title: Non-Diabetic Blood Sugar reading
